chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
commutativity Z multZ

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
addZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => addZ x0 y = addZ y x0) (eq_sym (add_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (add_IZ_succZ y)) (fun (n0 : nat) (H : addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => succZ z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (let H0 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) := eq_refl in (fun H1 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) => eq_ind (succZ (pos n0)) (fun z : Z => succZ (addZ y (...
inv_com : forall (S : Set) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (I x : S), commutativity S Mult -> (exists y : S, Mult x y = I) -> inversible S Mult I x
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
mult_OZ : forall x : Z, multZ x OZ = OZ
multZ_eq1 : forall n : Z, multZ OZ n = OZ
mult_IZ : forall x : Z, multZ x IZ = x
multZ_eq2 : forall n : Z, multZ (pos 0) n = n
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
mult_mIZ : forall x : Z, multZ x (neg 0) = oppZ x
multZ_eq4 : forall n : Z, multZ (neg 0) n = oppZ n
add_add : forall (S : Set) (Add : S -> S -> S), commutativity S Add -> associativity S Add -> forall x1 y1 x2 y2 : S, Add (Add x1 y1) (Add x2 y2) = Add (Add x1 x2) (Add y1 y2)
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
mult_succZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (succZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) x
mult_succZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (succZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) y
mult_predZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (predZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ y)
mult_predZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (predZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ x)
opp_com : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S), commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Add x y = O -> is_opposite S G Add O x y
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop
addneg = fix addneg (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => predZ x2 | S n0 => predZ (addneg x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addneg _ _%nat_scope
multpos = fix multpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => x2 | S n0 => addZ (multpos x2 n0) x2 end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments multpos _ _%nat_scope
addpos = fix addpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => succZ x2 | S n0 => succZ (addpos x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addpos _ _%nat_scope
tech_mult_posZ : forall (x : nat) (y : Z), multZ (pos (S x)) y = addZ (multZ (pos x) y) y
multZ_eq3 : forall (n1 : nat) (n : Z), multZ (pos (S n1)) n = addZ (multZ (pos n1) n) n
multneg = fix multneg (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => oppZ x2 | S n0 => addZ (multneg x2 n0) (oppZ x2) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments multneg _ _%nat_scope

```coq
Require Import Coq.Arith.PeanoNat.
Require Import Coq.Bool.Bool.

Theorem commutativity_Z_multZ : commutativity Z multZ.
Proof.
  intros.
  apply Z_ind; intros.
  - simpl. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- mult_OZ. rewrite <- multZ_eq1. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- mult_IZ. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- multZ_eq2. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- mult_mIZ. rewrite <- multZ_eq4. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- addZ_commutativity. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- tech_mult_posZ. rewrite <- multZ_eq3. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- multneg. rewrite <- multZ_eq3. auto.
Qed.

original: Require Import Coq.Arith.PeanoNat. Require Import Coq.Bool.Bool.
